title: Job Openings at Wendernek Consulting Limited
content:
Wendernek Consulting Limited is a leading human resource outsourcing management solutions provider in Nigeria. Our purpose is to provide applied and bespoke solutions to our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Quality Assurance / Quality Control Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
This role responsibilites cover the following:
Operations & Administration:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop a project quality plan in line with ISO 9001: 2015 international Standard and Contractual requirements, including QA/QC plans and procedures.
	Responsible for ensuring implementation of the quality management activities in an organised and efficient manner following the Project Quality Plan, Contract Scope of Work, and ISO 9001:2015 International Standard.
	Plan, prepare, implement, and continuously review the project quality management documentation and Client's mandatory quality requirements, specifications, and statutory requirements.
	Prepare and implement the quality plan, the QA/QC audit program, and QA/QC procedures.
	Ensure regulatory compliance on QA/QC matters.
	Determine, establish, and enforce the quality policy and objectives for the workforce.
	Assign duties to all QA/QC inspectors and follow up for prompt and efficient delivery.
	Convene internal QA/QC meetings regularly to discuss quality matters as necessary.
	Compile quality information needed for the management review.
	Support the implementation of site Health and Safety practices.


People Operations Management:


	Conduct quality induction training for project personnel to ensure they fully grasp the need to continually follow quality policy/objectives and project specifications.
	Provide leadership, mentorship, and direction to all the QA/QC personnel.
	Monitor personnel for compliance to safety rules and guidelines.
	Ensure all equipment is operated in a safe manner.
	Monitor all QA/QC personnel for use of PPE.


Project Management:


	Identify contractual requirements and advise the project manager and relevant discipline managers.
	Define required QA/QC resources needed during various project execution phases and manage QA/QC activities.
	Review material requisitions to ensure that the contractual quality-related requirements, specifications, and standards are incorporated.
	Oversee inspection, testing and equipment pre-mobilization activities.
	Establish measurable quality metrics/objectives based on the project needs at all levels of the organization.
	Plan, conduct, and report internal & external audits and reviews according to the agreed project audit program
	Maintain interface with other discipline managers, i.e., Engineering, Construction, Material Control, and Procurement, to ensure implementation of all quality concerns following the project specification, quality plan, and other supporting QA/QC procedures.
	Report promptly to the Chief Operations Officer/Project Manager on any quality-related problems and intended resolutions identified and which need to be resolved, including suggestions on improving project quality management activities.


Quality Audits and Inspections:


	Establish and implement the Inspection and Test Plan.
	Perform internal and external audits and, where necessary, raise appropriate corrective action requests and follow up with effective re-audit and closeout.
	Plan, execute, and lead quality management system audits for the design, procurement, construction, and commissioning processes.
	Carry out sub-subcontractors and suppliers Quality Audits under the external audit program.
	Manage all inspection and testing activities provided by sub-subcontractors and verify their inspection reports for accuracy
	Review and approve inspection and test plans, quality control procedures, welding procedure specifications, qualification records, and inspection records.
	Identify and develop solutions to correct deficiencies raised during inspections.


Vendor/Sub-contractor Quality Management:


	Participate in the pre-qualification/appraisal of suppliers (Sub-subcontractors /vendors).
	Attending bid clarification meetings with vendors and sub-subcontractors as necessary to reinforce the Client's position regarding quality.
	Establish criteria for evaluating and selecting suppliers.
	Ensure the activities carried out by Sub-contractors meet quality requirements.
	Review sub-subcontractor, Vendor, and Supplier Inspection & Test Plan, to assign inspection levels (hold, witness & review) as applicable.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field plus 10 years progressive work experience in a similar field.
	Extensive knowledge of quality assurance/quality control skills and procedures.
	Ability to perform a broad range of duties in quality assurance and quality control functions including the policy and procedure development.
	Strong knowledge of industry standards API, ASME, FMEA, SPC, Control Plans, and Experience in an ISO-9000/2015 quality environment.
	Working knowledge of formal structured problem-solving techniques and corrective action management and reporting.
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint and willingness to learn other job-related programs and software.
	Detail oriented individual with proven ability to work independently and as part of a team to prioritize work, multi-task and get results.
	Excellent Interpersonal and communication skills.


Salary
N1,000,000 per month (One Million Naira p/m).

Application Closing Date: 28th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Accounting Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Process invoices, receipts, and other financial documents.
	Assist with the preparation and analysis of financial statements, reports, and budgets.
	Maintain accurate and organized financial records, including journal entries, ledgers, and accounts receivable/payable.
	Reconcile financial transactions, accounts, and discrepancies to ensure accuracy and integrity of financial data.
	Assist with month-end and year-end closing processes, including reconciliations, adjustments, and accruals.
	Analyzing and reconciling procurement-related financial transactions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and procedures.
	Preparing and maintaining detailed financial reports, budgets, and forecasts related to procurement activities.
	Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify cost-saving opportunities and optimize procurement strategies.
	Monitoring and evaluating supplier performance, negotiating contracts, and ensuring timely payments.
	Providing financial insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making in the procurement department.
	Provide support and assistance to auditors, tax professionals, and regulatory agencies during audits and examinations.
	Stay updated on accounting standards, regulations, and best practices to ensure compliance and accuracy in financial reporting.


Requirements


	A minimum of a HND or Bachelor's Degree in Accounting.
	At least 3 years of proven experience in accounting, finance, or a related role.
	Strong understanding of accounting principles, procedures, and regulations.
	Proficiency in accounting software, such as QuickBooks, SAP, or Oracle.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in work.
	Organizational and time management skills.
	Communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Integrity and professionalism in handling confidential financial information.
	Adaptability and willingness to learn and grow in the role.


Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Human Resources / Legal Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Preparing job descriptions, advertising vacant positions, and managing the employment process.
	Orientating new employees and training existing employees.
	Provide legal guidance on HR policies, procedures, and compliance.
	Manage and resolve employment litigation and disputes.
	Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal labor laws and regulations.
	Oversee internal investigations related to HR issues.
	Develop and implement HR-related legal strategies and initiatives.
	Collaborate with the Human Resource Departmentand management on employee relations matters.
	Draft and review employment contracts and other legal documents with keen focus on legal precision, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
	Conduct training sessions on legal aspects of HR for staff members.
	Oversee Drafting, Review, and Negotiations when necessary.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in Law and must have been called to the Bar.
	Must have at least 2 (two) years of combined experience in HR and legal roles.
	Excellent knowledge of employment legislation.
	Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong analytical and research skills.
	Sound understanding of the HR functionand best practices.
	Effective interpersonal and communication skills.
	Ability to work well within a team and individually.


Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Catilas Resources Limited
content:
Catilas Resources Limited is an outsourcing and advisory services Company. Our focus is to help our clients leverage their core capabilities to optimize market opportunities.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Store Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking to hire an experienced and dynamic Store Manager to oversee the daily operations of our retail store.
	The ideal candidate will provide leadership, ensure smooth store performance, and deliver exceptional customer experiences through effective team supervision and product promotion.


Responsibilities


	Oversee daily store operations, maintenance, and product displays.
	Develop employee schedules and ensure adequate shift coverage.
	Promote products and drive sales to meet business targets.
	Provide excellent customer support and resolve inquiries promptly.
	Monitor store performance and maintain operational standards.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc. Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	2 - 5 years of proven experience in retail or store management.
	Strong leadership, communication (oral and written), and interpersonal skills.
	High level of flexibility and customer service orientation.


Salary
N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@catilas.com using "Store Manager" as the subject of the email.

‎Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Digital Marketer

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a creative and results-driven Digital Marketer to develop and implement online marketing strategies that drive brand awareness, engagement, and conversions across digital platforms.


‎Responsibilities


	‎Manage and optimize digital campaigns (social media, email, and paid ads).
	‎Create engaging content and track performance metrics.
	‎Improve website traffic and conversion rates.


‎‎Requirements


	‎HND / B.Sc. in Marketing or related field.
	‎Strong knowledge of digital marketing tools and analytics.
	‎Excellent communication and creativity skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@catilas.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Cashier

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Cashier to manage financial transactions and provide excellent customer service in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities


	Handle customer payments, deposits, and withdrawals efficiently.
	Maintain accurate cash records and reconcile daily transactions.
	Support account updates and assist customers with payment-related inquiries.


Requirements


	HND qualification / B.Sc. Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Strong numerical accuracy and attention to detail.
	Good knowledge of digital payment systems.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@catilas.com using "Cashier" as the subject of the mail.

‎Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Job Openings at Limewood Villa Hotel
content:
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Limewood Villa Hotel, is Located in the heart of Lekki Phase 1. Limewood Villa has accommodations with a restaurant, free parking, pool, bar and lounge. The facility offers 24 hours front desk and room service to its customers, along with free Wi-Fi throughout the property. Nearby attractions include points like Filmhouse Imax Cinema, Upbeat recreation center, Nike art gallery and Lekki conservation centre. With an excellent pool site, restaurant, garden sit out area and a roof top bar. At the hotel each room, is unique to the other. No room is the same, the rooms come with air conditioning, smart flat screen TVs, in-built Bluetooth speakers, luggage holder, electric tea pot, shower, free toiletries. All rooms have mini fridge in them. Featuring our executive suits, which are more spacious than the normal suits with a tube in the bathroom. Also, certain rooms comes with a balcony area to relax.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Waitress

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	A well-established hotel in Lekki Phase 1 is seeking a friendly, attentive, and service-oriented Waitress to join our hospitality team.
	If you enjoy creating memorable guest experiences and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and attend to guests in a professional and courteous manner.
	Take food and drink orders accurately and promptly.
	Serve meals and beverages efficiently.
	Ensure tables are clean and properly set before and after service.
	Handle guest inquiries and resolve complaints with grace.
	Collaborate with kitchen and bar staff to ensure smooth service.


Ideal Candidate


	Previous experience in food service or hospitality is a plus.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Neat appearance and good personal hygiene.
	Ability to multitask and stay calm under pressure.
	Willingness to work flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.


What We Offer


	Salary: N60,000 per month.
	Supportive team and positive work environment.
	Daily staff meals.
	Training and career growth opportunities.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hospitalityjobopening1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail..

Note: You can also WhatsApp: 08058043665 (Please send a message only).

 

 

2.) Cook

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you a skilled and reliable Cook with a passion for preparing delicious meals in a fast-paced hospitality environment?
	Our Hotel is seeking a dedicated team player to join our kitchen and help deliver exceptional dining experiences to our guests.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and cook meals according to established recipes and standards
	Ensure food quality, taste, and presentation meet hotel expectations
	Maintain cleanliness and organization of the kitchen and workstations
	Assist with inventory management and proper storage of ingredients
	Follow all health, safety, and hygiene regulations
	Support the Chef and kitchen team in daily operations.


Ideal Candidate


	Previous experience as a cook in a hotel, restaurant, or catering environment
	Strong knowledge of food preparation techniques and kitchen safety
	Ability to work efficiently under pressure and in a team setting
	Good communication and time management skills
	Flexibility to work shifts, weekends, and holidays as needed.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N90,000 - N100,000 monthly) and staff meals
	Supportive team environment
	Opportunities for training and career growth
	A chance to be part of a respected hospitality brand.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hospitalityjobopening1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail..

Note: You can also WhatsApp: 08058043665 (Please send a message only).

 

 

3.) Housekeeper

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Housekeeper is responsible for taking care of a Hotel building’s general cleanliness to provide tidy and sanitary amenities to guests.
	Their duties include cleaning floors, making beds and dusting surfaces throughout the Hotel.


Responsibilities


	A Housekeeper needs to clean the work area to the standards of limewood Villa Hotel.
	This requires attention to detail, physical strength and the stamina to work long shifts.
	Here are examples of a Housekeeper’s duties:
	
		Understand the company’s policy on work shifts, guest’s possessions and privacy issues.
		Provide basic housekeeping duties including changing the sheets, changing and arranging the towels, restocking toilet supplies, vacuuming, dusting and rearranging the room after guests check out.
		Report and return any guest properties found in the rooms while rendering service.
		Report cases of property damage in commercial spaces to supervisor.
		Work with a team of housekeepers on each shift.
		Clean, disinfect and store all equipment at the end of the shift.
		Maintain a positive relationship with employees and guests.
		Monitor and report on the inventory of cleaning supplies.
		Respond to calls for housekeeping problems, such as spills and broken glass.
		Collect and remove trash and debris.
		Assist with laundry management, including washing, drying, ironing and sorting linen.
		Report, turn in and log all lost and found items.
		Clean upholstered furniture.
		Perform detailed deep cleans when required.
	
	


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / NCE / HND / B.Sc Degree with a minimum of 3 years of work experience.


Salary
N60,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hospitalityjobopening1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail..

Note: You can also WhatsApp: 08058043665

 

 

4.) General Maintenance Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	General Maintenance Officer typically include a variety of tasks aimed at ensuring that the hotel buildings and equipment are well-maintained and functioning properly.
	The General Maintenance officer is responsible for performing routine and extensive preventative maintenance and repair procedures on buildings, mechanical equipment, and utility systems; however, experience in plumbing jobs is a great added advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform minor electrical maintenance, including but not limited to, replacement or repair of fixtures (e.g., wall switches and outlets, incandescent and fluorescent bulbs and tubes, ballast, sockets, fuses, minor appliances, cords, etc.) using appropriate hand, power, and specialty tools.
	Perform minor plumbing maintenance (e.g., replacement or repair of leaks in drains and faucets, unclogging of drains, trenching and laying new lines, replacing drain hoses on washers and similar devices, etc.).
	Perform minor painting, carpentry, and masonry work (e.g., preparing surfaces and using brush, sprayer, or roller to apply paints, stains, and varnishes, hanging doors, fitting locks and handles, etc.).
	Assist in the procurement of supplies and materials to complete all tasks.
	Maintain a schedule of when maintenance has been performed and when the next service is due.
	Work in a safe manner and recognize unsafe situations. Take appropriate action to ensure the safety of themselves and others in the building.


Salary
N100,000 - N110,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hospitalityjobopening1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail..

Note: You can also WhatsApp: 08058043665 (Please send a message

title: Job Openings at Tetra Maritime
content:
Tetra Maritime is a leading Nigerian ship owner and operator, providing comprehensive and tailor-made solutions across the oil and gas supply chain, including upstream, midstream, and downstream.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Corporate Affairs Manager

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Communications Lead is a seasoned professional who will lead a comprehensive communications strategy that supports our continuing growth.
	This individual will be the primary point of contact for and manager of all internal communications and will coordinate with external service providers to manage and elevate our external communications.
	The role demands exceptional verbal and written communication skills, strategic thinking, and a deep understanding of brand development and stakeholder engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Internal Communications Strategy & Execution: Design and deliver a cohesive internal communications framework that fosters transparency, alignment, and engagement across all departments and geographies.
	External Communications Coordination: Act as the liaison between Union Maritime and external agencies, and directly with media and others as necessary, ensuring consistency, quality, and strategic alignment in all external messaging.
	Brand Development & Stewardship: Lead initiatives to refine and deploy Union Maritime’s brand identity. Ensure brand consistency in tone, visuals, and messaging.
	Executive & Leadership Communications: Support the executive team with high-impact presentations, speeches, and strategic messaging. Translate complex ideas into compelling narratives.
	Crisis & Change Communications: Develop and implement communication plans for major organizational changes, crises, or strategic shifts. Ensure clarity, empathy, and control in sensitive situations.
	Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain relationships with key industry contacts, media outlets, and communication partners to enhance Union Maritime’s visibility and reputation.
	Top-Class Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication. Ability to craft clear and persuasive messages for diverse audiences.
	Strategic Thinking: Ability to align communication initiatives with business goals and anticipate communication needs in a dynamic environment.
	Brand & Narrative Development: Experience in shaping and evolving brand identity and corporate storytelling.
	Stakeholder Management: Skilled in managing relationships across internal teams and external partners, with diplomacy and influence.
	Presentation Excellence: Strong design and delivery skills for executive-level presentations and public speaking engagements.


Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application and CV to: D.yunusa@tetramaritime.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Senior Associate

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

The Position 


	We are seeking a dynamic professional to help lead the charity's activities in Nigeria. 
	This role requires exceptional organisation, process-management, and written and verbal communication skills, as well as the strategic and inter-personal capacity to promote the charity's mission and build and manage relationships across the charity's network.
	Candidates are likely to have a background in corporate-backed foundations, or other charities where there is sharp exposure to business and government (rather than reliance on public funding), but the role could also suit someone seeking to transfer from a high-quality corporate environment.  


Key Responsibilities 


	The core function is the provision of high-class leadership of the charity's activities in Nigeria, working with executive management in London to craft and deliver the charity's mission.
	In practical terms, that means engaging with and managing local stakeholders, including donors, network supporters, government, and training institutions.
	The role holder will also manage a growing team of operational and admin staff.    
	The role will require the preparation and presentation of high-quality reports and other communications for internal and external stakeholders. There will also be a focus on managing and improving business processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
	The role holder will be required to engage and represent the charity at a senior level, internally and externally. 


Requirements
Experience:


	The ideal candidate will have 8+ years of experience across fast-paced, professional environments in the corporate sphere (e.g., consulting, finance, legal) and/or from the charity sector. 


Skills and Competencies:


	Exceptional organizational and process management skills.  
	Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking.  
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  
	High attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities. 


Application Closing Date: 7th December,2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Admin Associate

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

The Position 


	The Global Admin person will ensure seamless office operations, compliance with company standards, and support for executive and departmental needs.
	This role is pivotal in maintaining operational continuity across Union Maritime’s Lagos office and collaborating with all Global Admin verticals to uphold global processes. 


Key Responsibilities 
Procurement & Vendor Management: 


	Execute procurement processes following company SOPs, including vendor onboarding, KYC, and conflict-of-interest declarations. 
	Prepare and submit procurement forms for COO approval before initiating purchases. 
	Maintain vendor databases and ensure timely payment processing through Tetra Accounts. 


Travel & Logistics Coordination:


	Arrange travel logistics for staff and visitors, including visa processing, and accommodation. 
	Manage local transportation and vehicle servicing schedules for company fleet. 


Compliance & Regulatory Liaison:


	Ensure adherence to Lagos State regulations (LAWMA, LASIMRA) for waste disposal and telecommunication utilities. 
	Handle immigration quota renewals and maintain expatriate workforce records. 
	Coordinate with police and fire services for statutory compliance. 


Financial & Administrative Support: 


	Manage petty cash, expense claims, and invoice processing. 
	Maintain trackers for inventory, procurement, and administrative tasks. 
	Support budgeting and cost optimization initiatives for office operations. 


Event & Meeting Coordination: 


	Plan and execute office-specific and corporate events, ensuring adherence to Global Admin event protocols. 
	Maintain event sheets and provide updates to stakeholders and COO. 


Office Operations:


	Oversee daily office operations, including reception, access control, and workspace readiness. 
	Manage cleaning schedules, gardening services, and ensure compliance with hygiene standards. 
	Coordinate repairs and maintenance for plumbing, electrical, and other infrastructure needs. 
	Monitor diesel supply for generators and liaise with approved vendors for replenishment. 


Communication & Documentation:


	Monitor shared mailboxes for timely response and task delegation. 
	Ensure proper filing and documentation on SharePoint for all administrative processes. 


Requirements
Experience:


	4–5 years in administrative operations, facilities management, or corporate services within a structured organization. 


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. 
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and SharePoint. 
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. 
	Knowledge of procurement processes and vendor management. 
	Ability to work independently and under pressure. 


Application Closing Date: 7th December,2025.

Click here to apply online

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "FumQuench is a premium parfait brand based in Lagos, Nigeria, dedicated to creating rich, creamy, and nutritious parfaits made with fresh fruits, crunchy granola, and smooth yogurt. Our goal is to redefine healthy indulgence by offering our customers a luxurious experience in every cup.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Social Media Manager will manage all social media pages, create engaging content, plan marketing campaigns, and build brand awareness.
	You will work closely with the management team to create and execute strategies that align with our brand tone and goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, create, and publish engaging daily content (photos, videos, captions, and stories) across all social media platforms.
	Develop and implement social media strategies to increase brand visibility and drive sales.
	Manage the social media calendar to ensure consistent posting and alignment with campaigns and promotions.
